verses.verse: When Israel<WH3478> went out<WH3318> of Egypt<WH4714>, the house<WH1004> of Jacob<WH3290> from a people<WH5971> of strange language<WH3937>;
Judah<WH3063> was his sanctuary<WH6944>, and Israel<WH3478> his dominion<WH4475>.
The sea<WH3220> saw<WH7200> it<WH5127>, and fled: Jordan<WH3383> was driven<WH5437> back<WH268>.
The mountains<WH2022> skipped<WH7540> like rams<WH352>, and the little hills<WH1389> like lambs<WH1121>.
What ailed you<WH3220>, O you sea, that you fled<WH5127>? you Jordan<WH3383>, that you were driven<WH5437> back<WH268>?
You mountains<WH2022>, that you skipped<WH7540> like rams<WH352>; and you little hills<WH1389>, like lambs<WH1121>?
Tremble<WH2342>, you earth<WH776>, at the presence<WH6440> of the Lord<WH113>, at the presence<WH6440> of the God<WH433> of Jacob<WH3290>;
Which turned<WH2015> the rock<WH6697> into a standing<WH98> water<WH4325>, the flint<WH2496> into a fountain<WH4599> of waters<WH4325>.
